message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR 

This paper deals with natural language processing and deep learning, which are common topics in the sub-categories of computational linguistics (cs.CL), machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), and information retrieval (cs.IR). The title and abstract suggest that the paper focuses on optimizing computation for sentiment classification, which is a task that falls under the umbrella of natural language processing. Therefore, cs.CL is the most likely sub-category. The use of deep learning models also makes cs.LG and cs.AI likely sub-categories. The mention of a decision network suggests that the paper may also touch on computer vision techniques, making cs.CV a possible sub-category. Finally, the use of metrics for evaluating performance suggests that the paper may also be relevant to information retrieval, making cs.IR a possible sub-category.
